array_item.tip: Carry a mug with you wherever you go for take out beverages.
If possible, choose a utility company focused on renewable energy.
Unplug your appliances when not using them to conserve energy in the kitchen
Organize a community group to clean up a local stream, highway, park, or beach.
Organize a community group to clean up a local stream, highway, park, or beach. When you are out hiking, pick up trash along the way.
When you are out hiking, pick up trash along the way.
Water your plants or garden at night to minimize evaporation.
Use your dishwasher - don't rinse dishes beforehand. Average savings is 20 gallons!
Switch your energy to wind power. It's easy, just go the the website for your energy provider. It only takes a few clicks.
Go paper free. Cancel paper statements for all of your credits cards/ bank accounts ect. Sign up for a service that will stop all ofyour junk mail.
Make a pledge to throw out less food. On average, households throw away 14 percent of their food purchases.
Eat less meat; the livestock industry is one of the worst polluters. When you do eat meat, look for meat that comes from local, humane farms.
Buy green cleaning products.-All the chemicals in normal cleaning products are overkill. You don't want that stuff in your home!
Don't print anything you don't have to.
Reuse the backsides of paper.
read a book...turn the tv off
Recycle your magazines and newspapers.
Reuse old shopping bags to line your trash cans. They are perfect size for the smaller bins.
Water your plants.
Simplify. Only keep things you use/enjoy on a regular basis, and you'll naturally buy less/create less waste in the future.
Only print on recycled, bleach free paper.
Only buy recycled, bleach free paper.
Replace paper napkins and paper towels with a special set of cloth towels/napkins. Just wash and reuse.
While shopping, if you only buy a few products skip the shopping bag. For larger purchases, bring your own reusable bag.
When traveling, look for environmentally friendly hotels. Also, use only one set of towels per trip.
When staying at a hotel, motel or B&B, let mgmt know you support businesses that adopt green practices (reducing waste etc).
Look around your home for items that can be donated to charity. EX: clothes, furniture, dishes, books, sports equipment.
Practice good recycling habits by using the containers provided by your town or city. If not provided, create them!
Buy food from local companies whenever possible, and support your local Farmer's Market.
If possible, grow your own fruits and vegetables using organic gardening practices.
If you are taking a trip, consider buying carbon emission offsets.
Whenever possible, keep lights off during the day.
Get family members into the habit of turning off lights when leaving a room (taping small reminder notes to switches helps).
Aggressive driving lowers mileage 33% on the highway and 5% in town. Driving above 60 mph also decreases mileage. Slow down!
Each time you turn on a water faucet use the lowest pressure necessary.
For drinking water, keep a pitcher in your refrigerator so you don't have to let water run to cool.
Always run full loads of laundry and dishes. Choose the short cycle at low water levels whenever possible.
If you buy a new appliance, switch to a water-conserving model (e.g., front loading washer).
Check your water meter when no one is using water in the house. If it's moving there's a leak.
Running toilet? To check yours, add food coloring to the tank w/o flushing. After 10 min, look for color (leaks)in the bowl.
Form a Arbor Day group with family and/or friends. Plan regular gatherings for tree-planting and watering.
Commit to planting and maintaining an agreed-upon number of trees over your life time.
Whenever possible, buy clothing made from organic cotton. The Keds Green Label CVO is made from 100% organic cotton.
If you are installing Christmas lights, consider purchasing more energy efficient Light-Emitting Diodes (LEDs).
Use a reusable bag for everything, not just groceries. The fancier the store, they cooler they thing you are for using a reus
Carry a cloth handkerchief in your purse. Use it instead of paper-towels/napkins when out and about. What they do in Tokyo!
Find a cool set of reusable silverware to carry in your bag wherever you go. Works better than the plastic stuff & no waste!
Be aware that almost everything you buy will end up in the landfilleventually. Choose wisely.
Buy higher quality.Spend a little more, to get the thing you really want. You'll get more use, and can resell if you need to.
Buy a good set of cast iron pots, and it will last many life times. No need to replace, and create more waste.
Use Craigslist and eBay to get rid of old stuff.
Shop vintage. Any time you buy something used instead of new you are helping mother earth out!
Choose products with less packaging.
Look for refillable pens, avoid disposable razors. Small things add up.
Buy the big jar of applesauce instead of the individual servings. Way less plastic ends up in the trash.
When you print something (especially from the web) check print preview to make sure you really need that last page.
Get better at grocery shopping, only buy what you can use before it spoils. And don't forget to eat your leftovers!
Walk instead of drive.
Even if things are a bit more expensive at your local market, buy there instead of driving to the superstore. Save gas.
Recycle electronics. Better yet, sell them so someone else can use them. I just got $100 for my old cell on ebay!
Give a goat! A charitable contribution is a perfect gift for friend w/everything. (oxfamamericaunwrapped.com/home.php?cat=9)
read a book...turn off the tv
Bring your utensils for lunch instead of wasting a plastic one.
Use cloth napkins instead of paper
Use a hankerchief instead of tissues.
Use cloth diapers instead of disposable,
Take the day off so you don't have to drive to work :)
Turn off lights when not in the room.
Use a Sigg water bottle instead of plastic...it's cool and green.
I've stopped getting reciepts at starbucks... less paper.
When buying foods like yogurt or other foods, try getting it in the big tubs or packages instead of individual ones.
Whenever using make-up, use mineral make up. It relaxes your face and is better than putting harsh chemicals on your face.
Spread the word! The best way to get everyone to go green is to talk about it.
Don't ever throw away leftovers. There's already enough trash in landfills, and food has feelings toooo you know. : )
Try to avoid rush hour. Driving in traffic burns more gas and increases pollutant emissions.
Buy eco-friendly shoes,jewlery, or handbags instead!
Only shop GREEN. SPREAD THE WORD TO YOUR PEOPLES!!!!!!!!
Use paper not plastic, REUSE paper, and better yet, buy reusable cloth bags.
When shaving at a sink, fill the bowl once and keep the running faucet off.
Have a million plastic grocery bags? take them to a local walmart and they will recycle them for you!
use cold water intead of hot water
Invest in a reusable water bottle,then don't use plastic ones.SIGGs are good ones
Leave a bowl outside so when it rains, you can use the rain water to water you plants instead of faucet water. :)
Wash your clothes in cold water! It saves you $$$ AND the environment!
Tell restaurants you don't need forks or napkins when you order take-out.
Offset air travel by purchasing carbon credits.
Buy timeless products, you will be more likely to keep something that doesn't look dated.
Put your reading chair near a window so you can read by natural light.
Lower your thermostat. Buy a programmable thermostat.
Reuse your water bottle. Avoid buying bottled water. In fact, reuse everything at least once, especially plastics.
Check out your bathroom. Use low-flow faucets, showerheads, and toilets.
Start a compost in your back yard or on your rooftop.
Buy in season.
Start a compost in your back yard or on your rooftop.
Recycle paper as well as plastic. And get small cars. Even better:hybrids
"The only way to get rid of a temptation is to yield to it." - Oscar Wilde
Unplug all of the electronic equipment that is not in use -all those digital clocks use unnecessary power.
At the end of the school year or work term, make sure you recycle all of your assingments and paper and plastic material.
Shut off your computer and go outside.
Use BAGGU reusable bags!
Unplug those cell phone charges when not in use!
i try to reuse my water bottles and plastic containers instead of throwing them out right away.
if buying new appliances make sure efficiency is a priority. if you can buy electric hot water heater you will save.
Recycle everything and clean up any trash you see on the floor
Open your widows. You can avoid turning on your air conditioning, and air-out your house.
Skip the paper cup at your coffee shop and bring your own mug in!
You can save gas and stop polluting by ordering online.
Don't sit idling your car if you don't need to. I wait to pick up my husband at the train and always turn off my car.
Buy in bulk to minimize paying for packaging. You get more bang for your buck AND avoid supporting excessive plastic!
Keep from leaving your sprinklers on a long time, let them water your lawn or garden for a short period of time.
Take shorter showers. Don't leave the water running while your putting shampoo in your hair!!
Encourage your teachers to double-side handouts or post papers online instead of printing them out for every student.
Save more water and earthGain more peaceful lifeGain more happiness!
When staying at a hotel/motel reuse the towels, ask housekeeping to not replace them everyday.
reuse containers- they can be used to take your lunch to work, or for storing leftovers-then recycle when they give out.
Try to avoid purchasing anything made in China as they are the number one producer of greenhouse gases.
Install energy saving light bulbs that don't need a surge of energy to turn on.
Use cloth napkins! Throw them in with the laundry you are already doing. Save: trees, bleach, energy and packaging!
see what you can change in your everyday rountine to be more green. for example only use wat your really going to use. =D
use recyable water bottle instead of buying water bottle on your way/
Unplug your phone charger between uses. Leaving a phone charger plugged in drains electricity.
Do good things for the environment :)
The best time of the day to water outdoors is either at sunrise or at sunset. This minimizes water evaporation.
Use a water efficient shower head. They reduce the amount of water you use and the shower is just as nice!!!
Let the sun shine in! It's bright and beautiful and free! Gotta love it!
Use your kids' art work as wrapping paper instead of buying it from the store!
Reduce. Re-use. Recycle.
Buy house hold cleaning products that are enviroment friendly such as clorox's new green works collection! they work great.
ReCYclE!
Live in a Go Green Apartment. Its worth the extra rent each month. : )
Compost things so you don't have so much trash.
I close the water tap while i'm brushing my teeth !
We recylce our daily newspaper every Thursday :)and have a recycling basket in our living room!
Look to buy clothes in organic cotton. It has a nice feel and is good for the envirionment. Also, buy used books
Start by recycling at home.
If and when you can, bike or walk to work
GO OUTSIDE!! You'll appreciate the environment so much more than if you sat inside. Do your best for our Earth!!
Try to use washable towels or rags instead of paper towels!
Use energy saving light bulbs instead of using regular ones.
Plastic or paper? NEITHER! Go for reusable canvas shopping bags!
Take showers INSTEAD of baths!
Bike or walk - this saves the air from pollutants. Also, file the unused papers in your older notebooks to make newer ones.
Car pool! Save gas and enjoy the company of your friends all at the same time.
Eat organic and local produce. Plant vegetables if possible; eat more vegetables than meat. Buy in bulk and share with family
Use a glass or a reusable bottle to drink water instead of buying a plastic one!
Why don't we just do what we did in the old days? Bring your own sacks to the store, and reuse bottles on a regular basis. =D
Hang drying the laundry
Enjoy the comfort of fresh air!- Not always the TV
Install Solar on your roof tops - govertment programs give you carbon credits for this! And it's a great savings on your ele
Use Bio-Diesel that is made from used oil (like from restaurants). A GREAT way to recycle used oils!
Compost, compost and compost and then it all goes into my lovely lasagna garden where I grow my vegetables and spices.
When you are out shopping and are only buying a thing or two, tell the cashier that you don't want a bag.
wash and reuse zip-lock bags and lunch baggies.
Placing a bucket outside so it fills up with rainwater then using that to fill up my watering can instead of using the hose.
Put mulch around plants, you will weed and water less.
During the summer when you aren't at home, turn up the thermostat a few degrees to save money and not waste so much energy
When leaving your classroom always turn off the lights.
when throwing away water bottles, unscrew the cap to allow the water inside to evaporate!
Try and get your local supermarket to charge for plastic bags, and donate money to local charities.
Always wait til you have a full load to do the washing.
TAKE YOUR BIKE!!
Turn off lights when leaving the room!!!!! please. :-)
Try to keep showers as short as possible ! And while you brush your teeth or wash up, make sure you turn off the faucet:)
Check for the recycling symbol before tossing something you think is trash, it can most likely be recycled!
Plant your own veggies. Better yet, start a community garden.
use water from a dehumidifier to water plants and use cloth towels instead of paper
Turn off your lights when you leave a room!It saves you money and helps the enviorment!!!!
Caught up with recycling? Try Pre-cycling instead. Skip the plastic bags and water bottles all together. Invest in reusable.
Take your refillable water bottle with you when you go outdoors.
I take my own carry out container when I go out to eat. This way I don't have to use the styrofome.
use amonia free dishwashing detergent. not only is it safer for the environment, it is also safer for small children
If everyone took a five minute shower instead of a thirty minute one it would save thousands of gallons of water.
Unplug your cell phone chargers when your not using them. They waste energy even without a phone attached to them. :-D
